reactions.name: Hemoglobin oxygen binding
reactions.conditions: cooperative binding (sigmoidal curve); Fe2+ in heme porphyrin; P50 = 26 mmHg
reactions.description: Cooperative O2 binding to hemoglobin's four heme groups. Fe2+ does NOT oxidize to Fe3+.

reactions.name: Cytochrome c oxidase (Complex IV)
reactions.equation: 4 cytochrome c (Fe2+) + O2 + 8 H+(matrix) -> 4 cytochrome c (Fe3+) + 2 H2O + 4 H+(IMS)
reactions.conditions: inner mitochondrial membrane; contains CuA, CuB, heme a, heme a3
reactions.description: Terminal oxidase of electron transport chain. Reduces O2 to H2O. Pumps 4 H+ per O2.

reactions.name: Biological nitrogen fixation
reactions.equation: N2(g) + 8 H+(aq) + 8 e- + 16 ATP(aq) -> 2 NH3(aq) + H2(g) + 16 ADP(aq) + 16 Pi(aq)
reactions.conditions: nitrogenase (Fe-Mo cofactor); obligate anaerobic conditions for enzyme; Rhizobium in legume root nodules
reactions.description: Nitrogenase reduces N2 to NH3 at ambient conditions. Requires 16 ATP per N2. FeMo cofactor active site.

reactions.name: Iron rusting
reactions.conditions: electrochemical process; accelerated by salt, acid, scratches in protective coating
reactions.description: Iron corrosion is an electrochemical process. Costs ~3.4% of global GDP annually.

reactions.name: Rust dehydration
reactions.conditions: ambient conditions; Fe(OH)3 dehydrates to reddish-brown rust
reactions.description: Hydrated iron(III) oxide (rust). Flaky, non-protective. Unlike Al2O3, does not passivate.

reactions.name: Blast furnace iron smelting (overall)
reactions.conditions: 1773 K; blast furnace with coke as reductant
reactions.description: Primary iron ore reduction. CO generated in situ from coke + hot air.

reactions.name: Basic oxygen steelmaking
reactions.conditions: 1923 K; pure O2 blown into molten pig iron; removes excess C as CO
reactions.description: Basic oxygen furnace (BOF) converts pig iron to steel by blowing O2. ~70% of world steel.

reactions.name: Dichromate titration of iron(II)
reactions.description: Dichromate is a primary standard (unlike permanganate). Orange to green color change.

reactions.name: Iron(III) thiocyanate test
reactions.description: Blood-red color confirms Fe3+ ions. Very sensitive test. Used in equilibrium demonstrations.

reactions.name: Prussian blue formation
reactions.description: Prussian blue: intense blue pigment. Historic iron detection test. Also used in art.

reactions.name: Permanganate titration of iron(II)
reactions.equation: MnO4-(aq) + 5 Fe2+(aq) + 8 H+(aq) -> Mn2+(aq) + 5 Fe3+(aq) + 4 H2O(l)
reactions.conditions: self-indicating; purple MnO4- decolorizes until endpoint
reactions.description: Classic redox titration. MnO4- is its own indicator (purple to colorless).

reactions.name: Copper sulfate + iron (tree of Diana)
reactions.conditions: iron nail in CuSO4 solution; copper plates out as reddish deposit
reactions.description: Iron displaces copper from solution. Classic activity series demonstration. Reddish copper deposits on iron.

reactions.name: Thermite reaction
reactions.conditions: ignited with Mg ribbon; reaches ~2500C; used for rail welding
reactions.description: Extremely exothermic aluminothermic reaction. Produces molten iron at >2500C. Used to weld railroad rails.
